resources.string: Open the app to finish activating it.
⚠️ You need to update the app
An important update is available. Update the app now to make sure it keeps working.
Reactivate Immuni as soon as possible so that it can warn you in the case of risk.
Someone you\'ve had close contact with has tested positive.
Open the app for more information.
Open the app if you have any updates about your situation.
An important update is available. Update the app now to make sure it keeps working.
Update your operating system to continue
A newer version of iOS (13.5 or higher) is required to enable exposure notifications.

string.name: permission_tutorial_update_os_first
string.b: 1. Open the system settings

string.name: permission_tutorial_update_os_second
string.b: 2. Go to \'General\'

string.name: permission_tutorial_update_os_third
string.b: 3. Go to \'Software Update\'

string.name: permission_tutorial_update_os_fourth
string.b: 4. Select \'Download and install\' and follow the instructions

resources.string: Connection failed. Please check your internet connection and try again.
Unable to connect. Please try again later.
With everyone\'s contribution, Immuni will help contain the virus and get us back to normal as soon as possible.
If you\'ve been in contact with a user who has subsequently tested positive for the virus, Immuni notifies you and gives you instructions to protect your health and the health of your loved ones.
Users who discover that they have been exposed to the virus can self-isolate, slowing down the spread of the virus and helping us return to normal life faster.
The app works without tracking your movements and without knowing your identity or the identity of the people you come into contact with.

string.name: privacy_item_identity
string.b: Immuni does not collect your first name, surname, date of birth, address, telephone number, or email address.

resources.string: Immuni cannot determine your identity or the identity of the people you come into contact with.
Immuni does not collect any geolocation data, including GPS data. Your movements are not tracked in any way.

string.name: privacy_item_secure
string.b: The data saved on your smartphone and the connections to the server are encrypted.

resources.string:
To help the National Health Service take care of you, Immuni tells the Ministry of Health server the following:
 - The province where you live
 - If the app is working properly
 - If you have been warned of a high-risk contact
Your data is saved on servers in Italy, managed by public bodies, and controlled by the Ministry of Health.
All data is deleted when it is no longer needed, and in any case no later than 31 December 2020.
I declare that I am at least 14 years old
By continuing, I declare that I have read and accepted the {terms of use}
Which region do you live in?
Select the region where you live to help the National Health Service provide the best possible assistance.
Which province do you live in?
Select the province where you live to help the National Health Service provide the best possible assistance.
Immuni uses Bluetooth Low Energy to log contact with other users so that it can inform you if you have been exposed to the virus.
Select \'Enable\' in the pop-up that appears below
Immuni uses Bluetooth Low Energy to log your contact with other users and to enable COVID-19 exposure notifications.
Notifications allow Immuni to alert you quickly should the need arise.
Select \'Allow\' in the pop-up that appears below
The use of Immuni is strictly personal. If you haven\'t done so already, set up a PIN on your device to protect it and prevent others from accessing your data and apps, including Immuni.

Immuni will only ever communicate with you via the app and the corresponding notifications. Be wary of any text, phone call, email, or other kind of alert that appears to be from Immuni, especially if it asks you for personal information.
Open Immuni periodically to check its status.
Take action now to allow Immuni to work properly.
What you can do to protect yourself
Find out what to do now ›
Follow the instructions provided by your general practitioner or local health authority
<h>Immuni assigns a random code to each phone</h>
The code is generated randomly and does not contain information about your device, let alone about you. It also changes several times an hour to ensure your privacy is protected.
<h>Phones that come into contact exchange their random codes</h>

When you come into contact with another Immuni user, the devices exchange their codes via Bluetooth Low Energy. That\'s how the app can keep track of the contact without knowing your identities or where you came into contact.
<h>Users who test positive can choose if they want to share their random codes</h>
Users who have tested positive for the virus can upload to a server the random codes that their devices have sent out over the previous days, making them available to other users.
<h>Each phone checks if it has previously encountered any of the shared codes</h>
Immuni periodically checks the codes on the server and compares them with those saved on your device. This allows it to determine if you have been exposed to a potential infection risk.
<h>The user is notified if there is a positive match</h>
If you\'ve been in contact with a positive user, Immuni notifies you and tells you what to do. It does all this without ever knowing where you\'ve been and who you\'ve met. Your privacy is safe.
1. Open Settings using the button below

string.name: permission_tutorial_notifications_second
string.b: 2. Go to \'Notifications\'

string.name: permission_tutorial_notifications_third
string.b: 3. Enable the \'Allow notifications\' option

resources.string: 1. Go to the Control Centre. Depending on your device, either swipe down from the top right corner, or up from the bottom of the screen.

string.name: permission_tutorial_bluetooth_second
string.b: 2. Turn on Bluetooth

string.name: permission_tutorial_exposure_notification_restricted_first
string.b: 1. Open the system settings

string.name: permission_tutorial_exposure_notification_restricted_second
string.b: 2. Go to \'Privacy\'

string.name: permission_tutorial_exposure_notification_restricted_third
string.b: 3. Go to \'Health\'

string.name: permission_tutorial_exposure_notification_restricted_fourth
string.b: 4. Go to Exposure Logging

string.name: permission_tutorial_exposure_notification_restricted_fifth
string.b: 5. Enable Exposure Logging

resources.string: 1. Open Settings using the button below

string.name: permission_tutorial_exposure_notification_unauthorized_second
string.b: 2. Enable exposure notifications

resources.string: This feature requires assistance from an authorised healthcare operator
Give the healthcare operator this code:
Wait for the healthcare operator to confirm
Exposure notifications are required for this process. Please re-enable them now to continue.
Something went wrong. Please check your internet connection and try again.
An error occurred during the operation. Please try again. If the problem persists, we suggest using a mobile network.
An error occurred during the operation. Please try again. If you are using a VPN, we suggest that you select a European server or temporarily disable it.
The following data will be uploaded
Wait for confirmation from the healthcare operator before uploading your data.
Risk indicators of previous contact with people who have tested positive for COVID-19
Select \'OK\' in the pop-up that appears below
Are you sure you want to exit?
Your data hasn\'t been uploaded yet.
If you are in contact with your general practitioner or your local health authority\'s health care service, follow all the instructions provided to you.
In any case, try to follow these general guidelines at all times:
Immuni has detected that you came into close contact with a COVID-19-positive user on %s.

string.name: suggestions_positive_subtitle
string.b: Follow all the instructions that you have received from your general practitioner or from your local health authority\'s health care service.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_ministerial_decree
string.b: Comply with the current regulations in your area.

resources.string: Wash your hands frequently with soap and water or with alcohol hand sanitiser.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_use_napkins
string.b: Cough and sneeze directly into a tissue or into the crook of your elbow.

resources.string: Respect physical distancing measures if you have to leave the house.
Wear a mask in indoor public places. This includes public transport and all situations where it is not possible to ensure that a safe distance is maintained at all times.
To protect your health and the health of your loved ones, please follow these guidelines:

string.name: suggestions_instruction_contact_doctor_title
string.b: Contact your general practitioner (or primary care paediatrician)

resources.string: Explain to your general practitioner that you have received a COVID-19 close contact notification from Immuni. Follow your general practitioner\'s instructions. Your general practitioner will contact your local health authority\'s health care service. You should therefore ensure that you remain contactable by your local health authority for health monitoring activities.
If you\'re in contact with your general practitioner or local health authority, you can hide this alert.
I have contacted my general practitioner
As a precaution, while you wait for instructions from your general practitioner or local health authority:
Stay at home for 14 days after the contact date

string.name: suggestions_instruction_check_symptoms_title
string.b: Measure your body temperature at least twice a day and assess if you are exhibiting symptoms, even mild ones.

resources.string: In particular, fever or at least one of the following: sore throat, cough, cold or blocked nose, difficulty breathing, muscle pain, loss or alteration of sense of smell or taste, diarrhoea.
If you display symptoms, isolate yourself from the people you live with.
Wear a surgical mask and immediately contact your general practitioner (or primary care paediatrician) and your local health authority\'s health care service.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_phone_contact
string.b: If you are having difficulty breathing, contact 112/118.

resources.string: If necessary, you can hide this alert. Unless you have a valid reason, we strongly advise against doing this.
Do you confirm that you are in contact with your general practitioner or local health authority?
Immuni will hide the contact alert. You will still need to follow all the instructions you have received from your general practitioner or local health authority.
Immuni is still working: don\'t uninstall it!
Do you confirm that you are COVID-19 negative?
Your local health authority needs to have confirmed that you have tested negative for the virus and can leave the house again.
1. Open Settings using the button below
Update Google Play Services to continue
A newer version of Google Play Services is required to enable exposure notifications.
Google Play Services isn\'t ready yet
Google Play Services is up to date but cannot enable exposure notifications yet. Please try again later.
Please wait for the Google Play Services update
The Google Play Services version required to enable exposure notifications is not available yet. Please try again later.

For exposure notifications to work, your phone\'s location services must be active at the system level. Immuni does not have access to location services and therefore cannot track your position or movements.
Do you want to hide this warning?
Unless you have a valid reason, we strongly advise against doing this. It could put your health and the health of those around you at risk.
Immuni assigns a random code to each phone
Phones that come into contact exchange their random codes
Users who test positive can choose if they want to share their random codes
Each phone checks if it has previously encountered any of the shared codes
The user is notified if there is a positive match
Are you sure you want to exit?
Select \'Share\' in the pop-up that appears below
Use a well-ventilated private room, if possible with its own bathroom.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_limit_movement
string.b: Minimise the time you spend in other common areas of the house.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_distance
string.b: Keep a distance of at least one metre when around other people.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_mask_title
string.b: Wear a mask in indoor public places.

resources.string: This includes public transport and all situations where it is not possible to ensure that a safe distance is maintained at all times.
An error occurred during the operation. Please try again. If you are using a VPN, we suggest that you select an Italian server or temporarily disable it.

To help the National Health Service take care of you should the need arise, the app has informed the Ministry of Health of the notification you have received. Please note, the Ministry of Health cannot determine your identity based on this information.
Risky exposure detected: contact with a COVID-19-positive person
For the time being, you will not receive any new notifications in the event of a risky exposure to a COVID-19-positive user.

string.name: suggestions_positive_covid_negative_message
string.b: Let us know if your local health authority has confirmed that you are COVID-19 negative to reactivate risky exposure notifications.
